required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Food Protein-induced Enterocolitis Syndrome (FPIES) in 14 Children
clinical_study.official_title: Food Protein-induced Enterocolitis Syndrome (FPIES) in 14 Children

brief_summary.textblock:
Food protein-induced enterocolitis syndrome (FPIEES) is a particular non-Immunoglobulin E-mediated food allergy.
A retrospective descriptive single-center study was conducted. Subjects included were children with acute FPIES who consulted the allergy department of the Nancy Regional University Hospital between November 2013 and June 2016.

detailed_description.textblock: As it is a descriptive study, the Primary Outcome is not a Measure. Therefore it is not possible to include the name of the measurement or measurement tool used to assess the measure in the primary outcome measure title.

primary_outcome.description: description of symptoms due to acute FPIES and chronic FPIES

study_pop.textblock: Children with acute FPIES who consulted the allergy oupatient clinic of the Nancy Regional University Hospital between November 2013 and June 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Child from 0 to 17 years with acute FPIES
Exclusion Criteria:
-
